verses.verse: But it displeased <S%H3415><s%> Jonah <S%H3124><s%> exceedingly, <S%H1419><s%> and he was angry. <S%H2734><s%>

He prayed <S%H6419><s%> to Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Please, <S%H577><s%> Yahweh, <S%H3068><s%> wasn't <S%H1697><s%> this what I said when I was still in my own country? <S%H127><s%> Therefore I hurried <S%H1272><s%> to <S%H6923><s%> flee to Tarshish, <S%H8659><s%> for I knew <S%H3045><s%> that you are a gracious <S%H2587><s%> God, <S%H410><s%> and merciful, <S%H7349><s%> slow <S%H750><s%> to anger, <S%H639><s%> and abundant <S%H7227><s%> in loving kindness, <S%H2617><s%> and you relent <S%H5162><s%> of doing harm. <S%H7451><s%>
Therefore now, <S%H3068><s%> Yahweh, take, <S%H3947><s%> I beg you, <S%H5315><s%> my life from me; <S%H2896><s%> for it is better for me to die <S%H4194><s%> than to live. <S%H2416><s%>"
Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Is it right <S%H3190><s%> for you to be angry? <S%H2734><s%>"

Then Jonah <S%H3124><s%> went out <S%H3318><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and sat <S%H3427><s%> on the east side <S%H6924><s%> of the city, <S%H5892><s%> and there made <S%H6213><s%> himself a booth, <S%H5521><s%> and sat <S%H3427><s%> under it in the shade, <S%H6738><s%> until he might see <S%H7200><s%> what would become of the city. <S%H5892><s%>

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> God <S%H430><s%> prepared <S%H4487><s%> a vine, <S%H7021><s%> and made it to come up <S%H5927><s%> over Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> that it might be a shade <S%H6738><s%> over his head, <S%H7218><s%> to deliver <S%H5337><s%> him from his discomfort. <S%H7451><s%> So he <S%H3124><s%> was exceedingly <S%H1419><s%> glad <S%H8055><s%> because of the vine. <S%H7021><s%>

But God <S%H430><s%> prepared <S%H4487><s%> a worm <S%H8438><s%> at <S%H5927><s%> dawn <S%H7837><s%> the next day, <S%H4283><s%> and it chewed <S%H5221><s%> on the vine, <S%H7021><s%> so that it withered. <S%H3001><s%>

It happened, <S%H8121><s%> when the sun arose, <S%H2224><s%> that God <S%H430><s%> prepared <S%H4487><s%> a sultry <S%H2759><s%> east <S%H6921><s%> wind; <S%H7307><s%> and the sun <S%H8121><s%> beat <S%H5221><s%> on Jonah <S%H3124><s%>'s head, <S%H7218><s%> so that he fainted, <S%H5968><s%> and requested <S%H7592><s%> for himself <S%H5315><s%> that he might die, <S%H4191><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "It is better <S%H2896><s%> for me to die <S%H4194><s%> than to live. <S%H2416><s%>"

God <S%H430><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Jonah, <S%H3124><s%> "Is it right <S%H3190><s%> for you to be angry <S%H2734><s%> about the vine? <S%H7021><s%>" He said, <S%H559><s%> "I am right <S%H3190><s%> to be angry, <S%H2734><s%> even to death. <S%H4194><s%>"

Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "You have been concerned <S%H2347><s%> for the vine, <S%H7021><s%> for which you have not labored, <S%H5998><s%> neither made it grow; <S%H1431><s%> which came up in a night, <S%H1121><s%> and perished <S%H6><s%> in a night. <S%H1121><s%>

Shouldn't <S%H2347><s%> I be concerned for Nineveh, <S%H5210><s%> that great <S%H1419><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> in which are <S%H3426><s%> more <S%H7235><s%> than one hundred twenty <S%H8147><s%> thousand <S%H7239><s%> persons <S%H120><s%> who can't <S%H3045><s%> discern between their right hand <S%H3225><s%> and their left hand; <S%H8040><s%> and also much <S%H7227><s%> livestock? <S%H929><s%>"
